"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure Security Defaults is disabled on Azure Active Directory"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Security defaults in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) make it easier to be secure and help protect the organization. Security defaults contain preconfigured security settings for common attacks. By default
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": Microsoft enables security defaults. The goal is to ensure that all organizations have a basic level of security-enabled. The security default setting i s manipulated in the Azure Portal. The use of security defaults however
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": will prohibit custom settings which are being set with more advanced settings from this benchmark."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Security defaults provide secure default settings that are manage on beha lf of organizations to keep customers safe until they are ready to manage their own identity security settings. For example doing the following: - Requiring all users and admins to register for MFA. - Challenging users with MFA- mostly when they show up on a new device or app
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": but more often for critical roles and tasks. - Disabling authentication from legacy authentication clients
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": which can't do MFA."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": "The potential impact associated with disabling of Security Defaults is dependent upon the security cont rols implemented in the environment. It is likely that most organizations disabling Security Defaults plan to implement equivalent controls to replace Security Defaults. It may be necessary to check settings in other Microsoft products
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": to ensure settings and functionality are as expected when disabling security defaults for MS365."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure multifactor authentication is enabled for all users in administrative roles"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Multi-factor authentication is a process that requires an additional form of identification during the sign-in process
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": such as a code from a mobile device or a fingerprint scan
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": to enhance security. Ensure users in administrator roles have M FA capabilities enabled."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Multifactor authentication requires an individual to present a minimum of two separate forms of authentication before access is granted. Multifactor authentication provides additional assurance that the individual attemp ting to gain access is who they claim to be. With multifactor authentication
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": an attacker would need to compromise at least two different authentication mechanisms
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": increasing the difficulty of compromise and thus reducing the risk."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": "Implementation of multifactor authentication for all users in administrative roles will necessitate a change to user routine. All users in administrative roles will be required to enroll in multifactor authentication using phone
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": or an authentication application. After enrollment
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": use of multifactor authentication will be required for future access to the environment."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure Sign-in frequency is enabled and browser sessions are not persistent for Administrative users"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "In complex deployments
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": organizations might have a need to restrict authentication sessions. Conditional Access policies allow for the targeting of specific user accounts. Some scenarios might include: - Resource access from an unmanaged or shared device - Access to sensitive information from an external network - High-privileged users - Business-critical applications Ensure Sign-in frequency does not exceed 4 hours for E3 tenants
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": or 24 hours for E5 tenants using Privileged Identity Management. Ensure Persistent browser session is set to Never persist NOTE: This CA policy can be added to the previous CA policy in this benchmark 'Ensure multifactor authentication is enabled for all users in administrative roles'"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Forcing a time out for MFA will help ensure that sessions are not kept alive for an indefinite period of time
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": ensuring that browser sessions are not persistent will help in prevention of drive-by attacks in web browsers
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": this also prevents creation and saving of session cookies leaving nothing for an attacker to take."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": "Users with Administrative roles will be prompted at the frequency set for MFA."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": "4.3 Configure Automatic Session Locking on Enterprise Assets"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure multifactor authentication is enabled for all users"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Enable multifactor authentication for all users in the Microsoft 365 tenant. Users will be prompted to authenticate with a second factor upon logging in to Microsoft 365 services. The second factor is most commonly a text message to a registered mobile phone number where they type in an authorization code
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": or with a mobile application like Microsoft Authenticator."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "Multifactor authentication requires an individual to present a minimum of two separate forms of authentication before access is granted. Multifactor authentication provides additional assurance that the individual attempting to gain access is who they claim to be. With multifactor authentication
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": an attacker would need to compromise at least two different authentication mechanisms
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": increasing the difficulty of compromise and thus reducing the risk."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Implementation of multifactor authentication for all users will necessitate a change to user routine. All users will be required to enroll in multifactor authentication using phone
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": or an authentication application. After enrollment
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": use of multifactor authentication will be required for future authentication to the environment. NOTE: Organizations that have difficulty enforcin g MFA globally due lack of the budget to provide company owned mobile devices to every user
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": or equally are unable to force end users to use their personal devices due to regulations
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.name": or policy have another option. FIDO2 Security keys may be used a s a stand in to this recommendation. They are more secure
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.date": and are very affordable for an organization to issue to every end user."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure Microsoft Authenticator is configured to protect against MFA fatigue"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Microsoft has released additional settings to enhance the configuration of the Microsoft Authenticator application. These settings provide additional information and context to users who receive MFA passwordless and push requests
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": such as geographic location the request came from
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": the requesting application and requiring a number mat ch. Ensure the following are Enabled .- Require number matching for push notifications - Show application name in push and passwordless notifications - Show geographic location in push and passwordless notifications  NOTE: As February 27
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": 2023 Microsoft will start enforcing number matching tenant-wide for all users using Microsoft Authenticator"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "As the use of strong authentication has become more widespread
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": attackers have started to exploit the tendency of users to experience 'MFA fatigue.' This occurs when users are repeatedly asked to provide additional forms of identification
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": leading them to eventually approve requests without fully verifying the source. To counteract this
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": number matching can be employed to e nsure the security of the authentication process. With this method
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": users are prompted to confirm a number displayed on their original device and enter it into the device being used for MFA. Additionally
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": other information such as geolocation and applicati on details are displayed to enhance the end user's awareness. Among these 3 options
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_3": number matching provides the strongest net security gain"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.date": "6.4 Require MFA for Remote Network Access"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure 'Phishing-resistant MFA strength' is required for Administrators"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Authentication strength is a Conditional Access control that allows administrators to specify which combination of authentication methods can be used to access a resource. For example
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": they can make only phishing-resistant authentication methods available to access a sensitive resource. But to access a non-sensitive resource
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": they can allow less secure multifactor authentication (MFA) combinations
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": such as password + SMS. Microsoft has 3 built-in authentication strengths. MFA strength
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": Passwordless MFA strength
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": and Phishing-resistant MFA strength. Ensure administrator roles are using a CA policy with Phishing-resistant MFA strength . Administrators can then enroll using one of 3 methods: - FIDO2 Security Key - Windows Hello for Business - Certificate-based authent ication (Multi-Factor) NOTE: Additional steps to configure methods such as FIDO2 keys are not covered here but can be found in related MS articles in the references section. The Conditional Access policy only ensures 1 of the 3 methods is used. WARNING: Administrators should be pre-registered for a strong authentication mechanism before this Conditional Access Policy is enforced. Additionally
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": as stated elsewhere in the CIS Benchmark a break-glass administrator account should be excluded from thi s policy to ensure unfettered access in the case of an emergency"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": "Sophisticated attacks targeting MFA are more prevalent as the use of it becomes more widespread. These 3 methods are considered phishing-resistant as they remove passwords from the login workflow. It also ensures that public/private key exchange can only happen between the devices and a registered provider which prevents login to fake or phishing websites."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": "If administrators aren't pre-registered for a strong authentication m ethod prior to a conditional access policy is created then a condition could occur where a user can't register for strong authentication because they don't meet the conditional access policy requirements
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": and therefore are prevented from signing in. :"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure that between two and four global admins are designated"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "More than one global administrator should be designated so a single admin can be monitored and to provide redundancy should a single admin leave an organization. Additionally
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": there should be no more than four global admins set for any tenant. Ideally global administrators will have no licenses assigned to them."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "If there is only one global t enant administrator
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": he or she can perform malicious activity without the possibility of being discovered by another admin. If there are numerous global tenant administrators
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": the more likely it is that one of their accounts will be successfully breached b y an external attacker."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "The potential impact associated with ensuring compliance with this requirement is dependent upon the current number of global administrators configured in the tenant. If there is only one global administrator in a tenant
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": an additional global administrator will need to be identified and configured. If there are more than four global administrators
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": a review of role requirements for current global administrators will be required to identify which of the users require global ad ministrator access."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": "5.1 Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Accounts"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure 'Self service password reset enabled' is set to 'All'"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Enabling self-service password reset allows users to reset their own passwords in Azure AD. When users sign in to Microsoft 365
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": they will be p rompted to enter additional contact information that will help them reset their password in the future. If combined registration is enabled additional information
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": outside of multi-factor
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": will not be needed. NOTE: Effective Oct. 1st

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": 2020. Tenants created after this date are enabled with combined registration by default."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": "Users will no longer need to engage the helpdesk for password resets
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": and the password reset mechanism will automatically block common
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_3": "Users will be required to provide additional contact information to enroll in self-service passwor d reset. Additionally
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.name": minor user education may be required for users that are used to calling a help desk for assistance with password resets. NOTE: This is unavailable if using Azure AD Connect / Sync in a hybrid environment."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure custom banned passwords lists are used"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "With Azure AD Password Protection
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": default global banned password lists are automatically applied to all users in an Azure AD tenant. To support business and securi ty needs
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": custom banned password lists can be defined. When users change or reset their passwords
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": these banned password lists are checked to enforce the use of strong passwords. A custom banned password list should include some of the following examples: - Brand names - Product names - Locations
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": such as company headquarters - Company-specific internal terms - Abbreviations that have specific company meaning"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Creating a new password can be difficult regardless of one's technical background. It is common to look around one's environment for suggestions when building a password
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": this may include picking words specific to the organization as inspiration for a password. An adversary may employ what is called a 'mangler' to create permutations of these specific words in an attempt to crack passwords or hashes making it easier to reach their goal."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": "If a custom banned password list includes too many common dictionary words
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": or short words that are part of compound words
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_3": then perfectly secure passwo rds may be blocked. The organization should consider a balance between security and usability when creating a list."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure password protection is e nabled for on-prem Active Directory"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) Password Protection provides a global and custom banned password list. A password change request fails if there's a match in these banned password list. To protect on-premises Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) environment
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": install and configure Azure AD Password Protection. Note : This recommendation applies to Hybrid deployments only
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": and will have no impact unless workin g with on-premises Active Directory."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Azure Active Directory protects an organization by prohibiting the use of weak or leaked passwords. In addition
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": organizations can create custom banned password lists to prevent their users from using easily guessed passwords that are specific to their industry. Deploying this feature to Active Directory will strengthen the passwords that are used in the environment."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "The potential impact associated with implementation of this setting is dependen t upon the existing password policies in place in the environment. For environments that have strong password policies in place
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": the impact will be minimal. For organizations that do not have strong password policies in place
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": implementation of Azure Activ e Directory Password Protection may require users to change passwords
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": and adhere to more stringent requirements than they have been accustomed to."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Enable Conditional Access policies to block legacy authentication"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Azure AD supports the most widely used authentication and authorization protocols including legacy authentication. This authentication pattern includes basic authentication
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": a widely used industry-stand ard method for collecting user name and password information. The following messaging protocols support legacy authentication: - Authenticated SMTP- Used to send authenticated email messages. - Autodiscover- Used by Outlook and EAS clients to find and connect to mailboxes in Exchange Online. - Exchange ActiveSync (EAS)- Used to connect to mailboxes in Exchange Online. - Exchange Online PowerShell- Used to connect to Exchange Online with remote PowerShell. If you block Basic authentication for Exchange Onl ine PowerShell
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": you need to use the Exchange Online PowerShell Module to connect. For instructions
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": see Connect to Exchange Online PowerShell using multifactor authentication. - Exchange Web Services (EWS)- A programming interface that's used by Outlook

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": and third-party apps. - IMAP4- Used by IMAP email clients. - MAPI over HTTP (MAPI/HTTP)- Primary mailbox access protocol used by Outlook 2010 SP2 and later. - Offline Address Book (OAB)- A copy of address list collections that are downloaded an d used by Outlook. - Outlook Anywhere (RPC over HTTP)- Legacy mailbox access protocol supported by all current Outlook versions. - POP3- Used by POP email clients. - Reporting Web Services- Used to retrieve report data in Exchange Online. - Universal Outlook- Used by the Mail and Calendar app for Windows 10. - Other clients- Other protocols identified as utilizing legacy authentication."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": "Legacy authentication protocols do not support multi-factor authentication. These protocols are often used by attackers because of this deficiency. Blocking legacy authentication makes it harder for attackers to gain access. NOTE: As of October 2022 Microsoft began disabling basic authentication in all tenants

"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": "Enabling this setting will prevent users from connecting with older versions of Of fice

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.name": POP or SMTP and may require upgrades to older versions of Office

This will also cause multifunction devices such as printers from using scan to e-mail function if they are using a legacy authentication method. Microsoft has mail flow best practices in the link below which can be used to configure a MFP to work with modern authentication: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/mail-flow-best-practices/how-to-set-up-a-multifunction-device-or-application-to-send-email-using-microsoft-365-or-office-365"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure that password hash sync is enabled for hybrid deployments"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Password hash synchronization is one of the sign-in methods used to accomplish hybrid identity synchronization. Azure AD Connect synchronizes a hash

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Enable Azure AD Identity Protection sign-in risk policies"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Azure Active Directory Identity Protection sign-in risk detects risks in real-time and offline. A risky sign-in is an indicator for a sign-in attempt that might not have been performed by the legitimate owner of a user account."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Turning on the sign-in risk policy ensures that suspicious sign-ins are challenged for multi-factor authentication."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": and client-based rules in Outlook. Administrators and users both are given several methods to automatically and quickly send e-mails outside of your organization."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Reviewing mail forwarding rules will provide the Messaging Administrator insight into possible attempts to exfiltrate data from the organization. Weekly review helps create a recognition of baseline
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": legitimate activity of users. This will aide in helping identify the more malicious activity of bad actors when/if they choose to use this side-channel."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "There is no impacting to reviewing these reports."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure all security threats in the Threat protection status report are reviewed at least weekly"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "The Threat protection status report s hows specific instances of Microsoft blocking a malware attachment from reaching users
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": phishing being blocked
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": impersonation attempts
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": etc. The Threat protection status report should be reviewed at least weekly."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "While this report isn't strictly actionable
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": reviewing it will give a sense of the overall volume of various security threats targeting users
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": which may prompt adoption of more aggressive threat mitigations."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure the Account Provisioning Activity report is reviewed at least weekly"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "The Account Provisioning Activity report details any account provisioning that was attempted by an external application."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "If the organization doesn't usually use a third party provider to manage accounts
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": any entry on the list is likely illicit. However
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": if the organization uses a third party provider
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": it is recommended to monitor transaction volumes and look for new or unusual third party applications that may be managing users. If anything unusual is observed
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": the provider should be contacted to determine the legitimacy of the action."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure non-global administrator role group assignments are reviewed at least weekly"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Non-global administrator role group assignments should be reviewed at least every week."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "While these roles are less powerful than a global admin
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": they do grant special privileges that can be used illicitly. If unusual activity is detected
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": contact the user to confirm it is a legitimate need."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure the spoofed domains report is reviewed weekly"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Use spoof intelligence in the Security Center on the Anti-spam settings page to review all senders who are spoofing either domains that are part of the organization
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": or spoofing external domains. Spoof intelligence is available as part of Office 365 Enterprise E5 or separately as part of Defender for Office 365 and as of October
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": 2018 Exchange Online Protection (EOP)."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Bad actors spoof domains to trick users into conducting actions they normally would not or should not via phishing emails. Running this report will inform the message administrators of current activities
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": and the phishing techniques used by bad actors. This information can be used to inform end users and plan against future campaigns."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps is enabled and configured"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps is a Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB). It provides visibility into suspicious activity in Microsoft 365
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": enabling investigation into potential security issues and facilitating the implementation of remediat ion measures if necessary. Some risk detection methods provided by Azure AD Identity Protection also require Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps: - Suspicious manipulation of inbox rules - Suspicious inbox forwarding - New country detection - Impossible travel detec tion- Activity from anonymous IP addresses - Mass access to sensitive files. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/ identity-protection/concept-identity-protection-risks"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "Security teams can receive notifications of triggered alerts for atypical or suspicious activities
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": see how the organization's data in Microsoft 365 is accessed and used
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": suspend user account s exhibiting suspicious activity
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": and require users to log back in to Microsoft 365 apps after an alert has been triggered."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure the 'Restricted entities' report is reviewed weekly"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Microsoft 365 Defender reviews of Restricted Entities will provide a list of user accounts restricted from sending e-mail. If a user exceeds one of the outbound sending limits as specified in the service limits or in outbound spam policies
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": the user is restricted from sending email
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": but they can still receive emai l."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Users who are found on the restricted users list have a high probability of having been compromised. Review of this list will allow an organization to remediate these user accounts
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": and then unblock them."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure Guest Users are reviewed at least biweekly"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Guest users can be set up for those users not in the organization to still be granted access to resources. It is important to maintain visibility for what guest users are established in th e tenant. Ensure Guest Users are reviewed no less frequently than biweekly NOTE: With the E5 license an access review can be configured to review guest accounts automatically on a reoccurring basis. This is the preferred method if the licensing is available."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Periodic review of guest users ensures proper access to resources."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure SharePoint external sharing is managed through domain whitelist/blacklists"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Control sharing of documents to external domains by either blocking domains or only allowing sharing with specific named domains."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Attackers will often attempt to expose sensitive information to external entities through sharing
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": and restricting the domains that users can share documents with will reduce that surface area."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Enabling this feature will prevent users from sharing documents with domains outside of the organization unless allowe d."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Block OneDrive for Business sync from unmanaged devices"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Microsoft OneDrive allows users to sign in their cloud tenant account
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": and begin syncing select folders or the entire contents of One Drive to a local computer. By default this includes any computer with OneDrive already installed
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": whether or not it is Azure Domain Joined or Active Directory Domain joined."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Unmanaged devices pose a risk
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": since their security cannot be verified through existing security policies
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": brokers or endpoint protection. Allowing users to sync data to these devices takes that data out of the control of the organization. This increases the risk of the data either being intentionally or accidentally leaked. Note: This setting is only applicable to Active Directory domains when operating in a hybrid configuration. It does not apply to Azure AD domains. If there are devices which are only Azure AD joined
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": consider using a Conditional Access Policy instead."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": "Enabling this feature will prevent users from using the OneDrive for Business Sync client on devices that are not joined to the domains that were defined."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "E nsure expiration time for external sharing links is set"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "The external sharing features of Microsoft SharePoint let users in the organization share content with people outside the organization (su ch as partners
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": vendors
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": clients
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": or customers). External sharing in SharePoint is part of secure collaboration with Microsoft 365."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "An attacker can compromise a user account for a short period of time
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": send anonymous sharing links to an external account
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": then take their time accessing the data. They can also compromise external accounts and steal the anonymous sharing links sent to those external entities well after the data has been shared. Restricting how long the links are valid can reduce the window of opportunity for attackers."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": "Enabling this feature will ensure that link expire within the defined number of days. This will have an effect on links that were previously not set with an expiration."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure 'third-party storage services' are restricted in 'Microsoft 365 on the web'"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Third-party storage can be enabled for users in Microsoft 365
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": allowing them to store and share documents using services such as Dropbox
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": alongside OneDrive and team sites. Ensure Microsoft 365 on the web third-party storage services are restricted."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "By using external storage services an organization may increases the risk of data breaches and unauthorized access to confidential information. Additionally
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": third-party services may not adhere to th e same security standards as the organization
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": making it difficult to maintain data privacy and security."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": "Impact associated with this change is highly dependent upon current practices in the tenant. If users do not use other storage providers
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": then minimal impact is likely. However
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": if users do regularly utilize providers outside of the tenant this will affect their ability to continue to do so."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": Google Drive
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": etc.). This could lead to information leakage and additional risk of infection from organizational non-trusted storage providers. Restricting this will inherent ly reduce risk as it will narrow opportunities for infection and data leakage."
